item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I have faults enough, but they are not, I hope, of understanding. My temper I dare not vouch for. It is, I believe, too little yieldingâ€” certainly too little for the convenience of the world. I cannot forget the follies and vices of other so soon as I ought, nor their offenses against myself. My feelings are not puffed about with every attempt to move them. My temper would perhaps be called resentful. My good opinion once lost, is lost forever." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A large income is the best recipe for happiness I ever heard of." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Adam Smith
item.description: "What is prudence in the conduct of every private family can scarce be folly in that of a great kingdom." -- Adam Smith

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are, you aren't." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people's money." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Look at a day when you are supremely satisfied at the end. It's not a day when you lounge around doing nothing; it's a day you've had everything to do and you've done it." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Bibliobee add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window." -- Gilles Deleuze
